quotes.quote: The ultimate aim of the ego is not to see something, but to be something.
Don't let your ego get too close to your position, so that if your position gets shot down, your ego doesn't go with it.
Ego is one of the biggest weapons that is used to take us down. It's self-destructive. It's a problem on all levels - even regular people can have big ego problems.
The ego is nothing other than the focus of conscious attention.
Ego is the immediate dictate of human consciousness.
The ego is not master in its own house.
Ego is a social fiction for which one person at a time gets all the blame.

To me the ego is the habitual and compulsive thought processes that go through everybody's mind continuously. External things like possessions or memories or failures or successes or achievements. Your personal history.
Ego is the great enemy. Ego will hold you back every single time.
When you're older and wiser a lot of the ego has gone out of the window.
The ego is as little absolutely permanent as are bodies.
People who think they know everything are a great annoyance to those of us who do.
The greatest conflicts are not between two people but between one person and himself.
Every man who is high up likes to think that he has done it all himself, and the wife smiles and lets it go at that.
Big egos are big shields for lots of empty space.
Our own self-love draws a thick veil between us and our faults.
Letting go of your ego opens the door to taking a new and creative course of action.
The nice thing about egotists is that they don't talk about other people.
It's hard to be humble when you are as great as I am.
The last time I saw him he was walking down lover's lane holding his own hand.
Well-ordered self-love is right and natural.
Ego expands to fill the space not filled with knowledge.
When ego is lost, limit is lost. You become infinite, kind, beautiful.
It is hard to resist a flatterer who gets it right.
You are the sky. Everything else - it's just the weather.
The Ego is an exquisite instrument. Enjoy it, use it-just don't get lost in it.
Self-worth comes from one thing - thinking that you are worthy.
I'm willing to admit that I may not always be right, but I am never wrong.
I live for myself and I answer to nobody.
Self-love seems so often unrequited.
